page.title: 03Sharnbrook Parish Council
page.content: {Sharnbrook Parish Council}was formed in 1894. At present the Parish Council is made up of 13 councillors elected by the village. A clerk deals with correspondence and minutes. The Council is responsible for street lighting, roadside grass cutting, footpaths and bridleways, allotments, and reporting on the state of the roads to the{County Surveyor. The Parish Council receives details of all{building projects}in the village, considers them, and passes comments to the{Borough Planning Department, which makes the final decision. The{precept,}received each year, is used for local projects including tree planting, provision of seating and litter bins and the payment of grants to support local interest groups.
